extendedIngredients.name: low sodium soy sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce

extendedIngredients.name: napa cabbage
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 medium head napa cabbage, thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: shiitake mushrooms
extendedIngredients.original: 4 ounces shiitake mushrooms, stems discarded and caps thinly sliced
extendedIngredients.originalName: shiitake mushrooms, stems discarded and caps thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound shelled and deveined medium shrimp

title: Warm Soba with Pork, Shrimp and Cabbage
summary: Warm Soba with Pork, Shrimp and Cabbage might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 4 servings with 468 calories, 30g of protein, and 11g of fat each. For $3.71 per serving, this recipe covers 22% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. If you have canolan oil, shrimp, soy sauce, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 30 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 52%, this dish is solid. Try Warm Soba Noodle Salad with Grilled Shrimp, Pork Chops with Warm Cabbage Slaw, and Warm Cabbage Slaw with Pork Medallions for similar recipes.
instructions: In a large soup pot, combine the soy sauce and dashi powder with 6 cups of water and bring to a simmer.                                               In a large saucepan of boiling salted water, cook the soba until al dente. Drain well.                                              In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil. Add the pork and mushrooms and cook over high heat, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms are lightly browned and the pork is no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Add the shrimp and cook, stirring occasionally, until curled, about 3 minutes. Add the cabbage and cook just until wilted, about 1 minute. Scrape the mixture into the soup pot. Add the noodles and simmer just until heated through, about 1 minute. Serve in deep bowls, garnished with the scallions.

steps.step: In a large soup pot, combine the soy sauce and dashi powder with 6 cups of water and bring to a simmer.
In a large saucepan of boiling salted water, cook the soba until al dente.
In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil.
Add the pork and mushrooms and cook over high heat, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms are lightly browned and the pork is no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
Add the shrimp and cook, stirring occasionally, until curled, about 3 minutes.
Add the cabbage and cook just until wilted, about 1 minute. Scrape the mixture into the soup pot.
Add the noodles and simmer just until heated through, about 1 minute.
Serve in deep bowls, garnished with the scallions.
